title: Area code 574
text:
Prior to 2002, the northern third of Indiana had been served by <a href="area%20code%20219">area code 219</a> for 54 years. However, by the end of the 20th century, 219 was on the verge of exhaustion. It was decided to implement a three-way split of the 219 territory. As the result of a random drawing, the middle portion of the old 219 territory (South Bend) became 574. The eastern portion (<a href="Fort%20Wayne">Fort Wayne</a>) became <a href="area%20code%20260">area code 260</a>, while <a href="Northwest%20Indiana">Northwest Indiana</a> retained 219. The area codes split on January 15, 2002, with <a href="permissive%20dialing">permissive dialing</a> continuing until June 14, 2002.
Prior to October 2021, area code 574 had telephone numbers assigned for the <a href="central%20office%20code">central office code</a> 988. In 2020, "988" was designated nationwide as a dialing code for the <a href="National%20Suicide%20Prevention%20Lifeline">National Suicide Prevention Lifeline</a>, which created a conflict for exchanges that permit <a href="seven-digit%20dialing">seven-digit dialing</a>. This area code was therefore scheduled to transition to <a href="ten-digit%20dialing">ten-digit dialing</a> by October 24, 2021.
